text: Bottle shared. A strong but elegant BSA. Dark amber with ample light tan head. Aroma and flavor of bready yeast, clove, wine, sweet candi sugar. Slightly sharp finish with a little alcohol showing, but less than the Prestige. High carbonation.

(bottle) hazy greyish amber-brown colour with a frothy light-beige head. aroma of bubble gum and sugar icing, slightly musty, with a light hint of spruce, some eucalyptus, ethanol and dried cherries. flavour is mostly the same, lots of cherry schnaps and bubble gum, robustly ethanolic, with some notes of toasted wood, some dried cranberries and a semi-dry mojito finish. heavy-bodied with lively carbonation.

Âmbar escura de média turbidez, leve precipitação, espuma avermelhada de média formação e pouca persistência. Aroma com bastante uva, álcool, barril, complexa. Corpo licoroso e baixíssima carbonatação. Final de longa persistência trás bastante do vinhos dos barris, maltada, muito boa.

Aroma of grapes, burgundy, black currants, caramel, toffee, and clove. Taste is a bit of a let down compared to aroma, much more muted, a bit oak, vanilla, toffee, belgian yeast esters. Pretty thin and spritzy but quite drinkable.

Butelka. Duzo ciemnych owocow, beczka, drewno, wino. Alkohol swietnie ukryty. Nasycenie.srednie. długie posmaki.
Pours amber, clear, low head. Plum, sweet dark fruits, dry fruits, caramel, yeast, coconut, cherries. Dry, than sweet, fruity. Full body, fizzy, thick. Special one.

8. 12. 2016, Ljubljana, Gas Station with boyz. Bottled. Excellent crossover between champagne and beer. Very unique and outstanding.

O.75l bottle. Pours dark amber colour with huge white head, hazy liquid. Aroma of white wine, some apple jam, flowers, yeast notes. Lightly sweet, high sourness, no bitterness. Full body, long lasting white wine aftertaste.

0.75 bottle. Pours murky brown color with huge off-white head. Sour aroma of fruits, yeast, caramel. Flavor is medium sweet, light bitter, medium sour. Very winy taste. Finish is medium long and sour. Medium to full body, lively carbonation.

Bottle 75cl given by VDuquerroux, a cloudy amber brown beer with low head. Nose is vinous with wild yeast notes. Aroma is on caramel, oak, wild yeast near to oude bruin, tannic, medium sweet ti high, vinous, yellow fruit notes, quite strong.

75cl bottle shared at Leightons. Many thanks to LKS for this one. It pours a clean Amber color with a medium off white head. Aroma is sweet and acidic with not s of red wine strawberries caramel vanilla. Taste is also big bold sweet and acidic with notes of red grapes, red wine, caramel, vanilla, chocolate. Medium bodied with lively carbonation. Overall, very nice

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2016 750mL bottle, 2014 vintage. Pours hazy copper with a persistent off-white head. Strongly fruity aroma, very dense and complex but with a malty and slightly acidic backbone, some wood. Quite sweet and malty but offset by the acidity, minimal bitterness. Full body, mild carbonation and a lingering acidic fruity finish.

Flaska från Beergium drucken med ölföreningen. Stor kropp och fruktig sötma men helt utan alkoholvibbar, Laktosyrlig och vinös med smak av fruktig rödvin, körsbär och plommon. Riktigt bra balans. Fantastiskt gott.

Cork and caged .75 litre bottle between five at the Dec 2016 Shrewsbury Beer Exchange Club meeting: cheers me for taking this 2014 bottled beauty. Red hue to the amber body, the head a thin off-white affair. Wine like in the nose, with spices and herbs with a woody undertone. Taste wise it was semi-sour red wine, oak aged and again spicy like the aroma. Not too sure what I was expecting, but it wasnt a Flemish Red/Oud Bruin sort of brew base.

Bottle shared in London - big thanks to beersiveknown. Pours lightly hazy golden-brown with a dense, frothy off-white head. The aroma has some lightly tangy fruits, orange, bread, berries. Medium sweet flavour with a nice, light acidity that cuts through the body, some further orange, melon, pale bread. Medium to full bodied with massaging carbonation. Warming finish with restrained tang, some lemon, tangerine, a little orange peel, light woody dryness. Great balance overall. Well and drinkable.

Bottle split at Bespin, big thanks to Beers Ive Known and Leighton, 08/12/16.
Hazed reddish amber with a decent light beige covering.
Nose is earthy fruit rinds, nutty, woody, red wine tang, spice, fruit loaf.
Taste comprises fruit rinds, spice, rising alcohol, sharp boost, red berry linger, sharp fruits, toffee, spice, light red berry rasp, soured fruit tang.
Medium + to full body, fine carbonation, warming alcohol in the close.
Decent strong ... drinks below the ABV.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at Leightons place. 8/12/2016. Many thanks to Leighton for this one. A hazed amber reddy coloured pour with a frothy beige head. Aroma is sweet biscuity malts, apple, nutty, Belgian yeast, tangy apple. Flavour is composed of semi sweet, little brett funk, tangy apple, little tart lacto wine, vinous fruit, spicy wood. Palate is semi sweet, tart, highish carbonation. Interesting beer.

75cl bottle @ shared at monthly tasting, Chez Sophie, brought by Blackhaddock. Thanks Blackhaddock. Pours a deep reddish amber, off-white head. Aroma is vinous, oaky, bourgogne wine and balsamic oud bruin. Taste is tart, earthy ripened berry fruits, oud bruin oaky warmth, good wine influence. Balanced and somewhat restraining on the strength, but still very warming thanks to the barrel aging. Good winter beer.

Bottle from Beers of Europe shared with Lee, Keith and Phil; clear dark amber pour with a bubbly tan head, aroma has dark cherries, taste has tart dark fruits, some cherries, almond nuts, hint of wood.

75cl-fles van bij Tabac&Co - Palais des bières te Dottenijs (in Famiflora). U: Wazig bruin met kleine beige schuimkraag. G: Karamel, gedroogd fruit en een rode wijntoets. S: Zoet met een licht bittertje, karamel, melkchocolade, rode wijntoetsen die niet overheersen. Lekker! M: Volmondig met medium carbonatie.

A Dubuisson meseszerű főzete már első ránézésre is nagyobb lehetőségek hordozója, mint a "Prestige" nevezetű típus, mely két példány között a rokoni viszony bár egyeneságinak tekinthető, ebben a kontextusban jelen tesztalanyunkra mindenképpen felmenőként tekintsünk. Méltóságteljes külleme mély, opálos test kivetülése, melyre mennyeien krémes, tejfehér hab kenődik egy ujjnyi vastag rétegben, a mulandóság pedig a krémhab számára voltaképpen ismeretlen fogalom. Ez alól röppennek fel aztán a szabadjára engedett csemegekosár-aromák, a mézes, mazsolás, almakompótos, finom likőrös, aszús és élesztős illatok, hogy aztán ízjegyek formájában szinte mind testet is öltsenek. Intenzív jelleggel, desszertboros hangulatban, aszalt gyümölcsös elemek nyitnak be elsőként, majd olvadnak szét krémesen a puha, mégis élénk szerkezet keretében. A kompozíció buja élesztővel fonódik be ezután, némi fahordós, boros lenyomatot kap, majd ugyanolyan üdén, mint ahogyan érkezett, az alkohol jótékony pártfogásában, megnyerő stílusban, sziporkázva, szárazan, mégis gyümölcsösen köszön le. "Prestige" ide, vagy oda, számomra ez viszi a pálmát.

75cl bottle. The beer is cloudy brown with big but quickly disappearing head. Aroma is intensive, almost aggressive. Strong notes of dried fruits like figs, apple and grapes. Some cherries, banana and apricot. Also lots of barrel aging notes well balanced with the rest like vanilla, wood tannin, red wine. Quite sweet malty notes of chocolate tart with prunes. Complex and intensive. Mouth feel is very soft and fluffy with medium strong carbonation. It does foam when swallowed so it needs some de-carbonisation. Medium thick. Taste ? It is very complex. Overall quite dry with fruity and spicy notes . But not like a semi-sec wine but more like a tart with fruits but not much sugar. Alcohol is warming but apart that it doesnt exist. Finish is a bit fruity sour and herbal. Still very smooth even in the finish.

Rocznik 2014. Aromat intensywny, suszone owoce, czerwone wino, beczka, wanilia, przyprawy, karmel, lekka kwaskowatość, alkohol. Kolor ciemnobrązowy, mętne. Piana obfita, drobna, trwała, ładnie zdobi szkło. W smaku słodkie, pełne, owoce, suszone owoce, czerwone wino, karmel, toffi, przyprawy, drewno, wanilia, lekka kwaskowatość, delikatnie rozgrzewający alkohol. Goryczka niska, wysycenie niskie. Kapitalne piwo!

Le risque est toujours grand de faire maturer des bières dans des fûts de chêne. Le résultat en est trop souvent un maelstrom gustatif, intense, mais peu appréciable. En partant dun Bush de Noël, déjà riche en arôme, le pari de la Brasserie Dubuisson était donc grand. 
La Bush de Nuit présente une teinte cuivrée tirant sur le bronze, avec une effervescence moyenne et une légère mousse la surplombant saffaissant très rapidement. 
Au nez, ce qui frappe immédiatement, ce sont les notes acidulées de cerise tirant sur le porto.
A la dégustation, lattaque est directement sur le boisé, très légèrement enrichi par le malt et la levure. En deuxième, vient ensuite lexplosion en bouche. Lacidité sur des notes de cerise et de raisin prend la dominante ; le côté boisé conférant une grande puissance gustative. En final, on atteint des notes marquées de pommeau aux pointes épicées.
Léquilibre de cette bière est exceptionnelle. Les 13 % Abv ne se sentant incroyablement pas, la bonne acidité (et non le trop de sucre...ouf!) venant contrebalancer la titrage alcoolique.
Le pari est gagné! Merci Dubuisson.
August 6, 2016 - bottle shared with Jake from AV3. Light brown pour with limited head and floating sediment. Aroma and taste of dark fruit, wood, spice, yeast and alcohol.

750ml bottle served in a chalice glass. Pours a cloudy dark amber color forming a small and solid tan head with medium retention and only few spotty lacings left in the glass. Strong notes of red fruits, oak and caramel malts in the nose. Candi sugar and slightly sour notes. Hints of honey and alcohol. Taste follows the nose: Sweet and fruit upfront. Strong notes of red fruits, mainly grapes. Strong notes of oak too. Candi sugar and caramel malts. Wine vinegar. Light sourness. Reminds a Flanders Red Ale. Bready style Belgian yeasts. Full body. Medium to low carbonation. Winy and light sour aftertaste. Excellent drinkability. Masterpiece.

Une bière grandiose à la robe brune claire, fine mousse. Une nez dune rare complexité avec à la fois des arômes de fruits rouges, un coté vineux, des épices, un boisé présent mais intégré et une bouche tout aussi impressionnante, de lampleur, de la puissance, de la richesse et de léquilibre et le tout sans excès. Un régal.

A majestic looking 0.75l corked bottle from trade with BelgBeerGeek. This is the 2011 version. It pours a cloudy plum red colored body with a big but somewhat quickly fading and big bubbled off-white head. Smells really Belgian and dark candied sweet. Lots of fruity yeasty tones, a bunch of honey, some alcohol, sour red berries - lots of them actually. Also I get traces of both red wine and vanilla. Smells quite complex and nice. Even if it has had a few years in the bottle it still feels a bit raw and almost brutal. Not that I was expecting a mild or a bitter, but I had thought it would be a bit less in your face. Above average on the carbonation and it has a surprisingly thin oily mouthfeel. Nice red berries, lots of oak tannins, Belgian candy, warming alcohol. Lots of flavor in this, and the barrels has really made an influence. Soft dry autumn leafs, a bit of acidic lingon berries, watered down red wine vinegar and traces of something thats remaining me of the bitterness in cocoa nibs. Honey also present in the flavor. Lots of things going on here, perhaps even a bit to much, making it a bit all over the place. Im enjoying it more and more the further down the bottle I get. Thanks for the bottle Vincent! 07.04.2013

750ml bottle, age 2014, from Bier Tempel, Brussels. Dried dark fruits, red wine, rich. Pours medium brown with a slight white foam. Taste of rich thickness but not thick, if you will, again dark fruits, maybe caramel, s bit of red wine dryness, with some oak back notes with Belgian yeasts, some phenolics. The finish is clean. I will buy this beer again.

750mL corked & caged bottle from Beer Cartel.
It must be said - this beer has majesty before even sampling - an amazing bottle, a placard full on info, an just amazing appearance before a deep copper body is presented.
Aroma exudes ripe fruits, dried fruits, burnt caramels, typical phenolic & esters!
Body is unbelivably strong but works so well - wow!

Amberkleurig bier met fijne witte schuimkraag. Intens aroma. Geur van pruimen, vineus, beetje cognac. Licht alcoholisch, diepe volle smaak van kandijsuiker, caramel, eik met lekkere zoete afdronk. Topdrankje.
Pours a dark amber body with a medium head. Nice malty aroma with a fruity feel. Rich and well balanced taste with a nice fizzy fruityness.

75cl bottle, pours a deep red-brown, aromas of cherries and strawberry, rich and dry-fruity, dry-sweet body with light astringent esteryness, bitter fruitiness with touches of dry wood. Gorgeous, especially now its aged a year.

Bottle - as Cuvée Spéciale 2014 - from Beerexpress when they were still residing on Gonsiori street (was I think  24), shared with Mait. The bottle design is different, more traditional than the one pictured. BB 16.12.2017. Pours not very attractive coppery brownish, opaque. No head. Lovely, slightly vinegary aroma of oak, unripe red grapes, whitecurrants and gooseberries. Tastes sweet and sourish bitter, red wine, woody and ripe stone fruit flavour, cherry stones... Version from 2014. ---- Amber with medium white head. Aroma malty, nuts, bread, alcohol, nougat, vinous, barrell and alcohol. Taste has malt, bread, nougat, nuts, sweet malt, vinous with heavy wine notes.

Look: brown cloudy with particles.

Aroma: brett, toffee, vanilla, wood.
Taste: moderate sweetness with mild acet sourness.
Flavour: malt, caramel, bisquit, some candied fruits, some earthy notes.

Very good but no so intense as Bush Prestige.

BOTTLE 75 CL. Clear red-brown, small head. Quite close to the original Prestige - both aroma and the taste have mild acetic notes, oxidized wine and enough malts to balance. A bit of alcohol just spices the things up. Very nice.

Brown and hazy. Long lasting carbonation. No head. Smells wine, sour / Brett with a bit of vinegar. Empty body with sour / acid finish. Some sweet malty and alcohol notes are present throughout taste and aftertaste

F: not very big, off-white, quick gone but for such a beer it´s ok.
C: reddish to brownish, a little hazy.
A: red wine, oak barrel, hint of honey, vinous sour tones, caramel, sherry, hint of barnyard, berries, herbal spicy.

Drunk from 75cl bottle bought in Delhaize. Dark barley malt beer aged in Nuits Saint Georges wine barrels.

Bottle. Moderate caramel, cereal and nuts for the malt, light herbs and citrus for the hops, light to moderate dough and broth for the yeast, with date, raisin, ripe banana, toffee and a hint of vinegar. Head is average sized, frothy, light beige, with thick but slippery lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is slightly hazy burgundy. Flavor starts lightly sweet and moderately acidic, then finishes lightly to moderately sweet and acidic and lightly bitter. Palate is on the fuller side of medium, slick with a fizzy carbonation and a tangy finish. A savory aroma, and a great mix of sweet and tangy in the flavor. A top notch Belgian Strong Ale.

750 C&C bottle (2012) thanks to Mac Boost from the 2015 FBW adneilsen Photoshop contest! Gusher upon opening. Poured a dirty brown color with a big foamy tan head. Aroma of red wine, oak, Belgian yeast, funk, and hints of vinegar. Taste of amber malts, nut shell, oak, funk, and red grapes.
Clear brown color with little foam. Sour nose with light vinegar aromas. The beer tastes like dry bread dipped into delightfully sour vinegar. Calm dryish vinegar aftertaste.

Bottle. Smooth nose, with lightly spiced aged fruit, and dark honey. Hazy light copper/brown color, with thick, persistent lace. Beautiful array of matured fruit, lightly tart stone fruit in mid palate, small sugary sweetness lasts and lasts. Complexity and overall balance is amazing. Full-bodied, rich, and exceptionally smooth.

2012 bottle, bought outside of Leuven. Fantastic nose or grape, caramel, vanilla. Not all that pretty: a kind of cloudy orange-brown color with a huge, airy head. Huge flavors: grapes, wood, figs, vanilla. Very creamy, with a lovely soft carbonations. Nice tartness in the background. Smooth and silky. A lovely beer.

Bottle of 75cl, in a Trappist glass; room-temperature.

One of the great beer Ive taste. Powerfull, with a great colour and taste. The subtle mix of beer and wine is far more than great.

Try it, you wont regret it !
Nice, long drinking beer, with lots of complicated aroma in taste: raisins, caramel, vine and yes - it is strong, but overall well balanced beer. Nice experience.

2009 vintage. 

Pours a very cloudy, dark chestnut brown color thats completely opaque with only the faintest of copper colored edges. Half finger off-white head that immediately disappears into a very thin ring that doesnt last. Not much in the way of lacing. 

The aroma is dominated by the vinous red wine barrel character giving off lots of toasted oak and tart dark fruit notes. The oak really stands out and is somewhat charred and ashy with a toothpick-like quality but this is countered by vinous grape, sour cherry, currant, fig and other dark berries. Along with the barrel notes there are some floral hops, peppery spice and sweeter malt notes, notably caramel and toffee. Slightly syrupy/medicinal but thankfully this is overpowered by the oak and red wine notes. 

Medium bodied with a surprising amount of carbonation for the style and strength along with a really nice, dry red wine barrel flavor thats nicely integrated into the flavors of the base beer. The oak presence is dry and toasted but isnt as strong as the nose suggests. I was worried that there would be too much dry oak/toothpick flavor but this beer has the perfect amount, adding another layer of flavor without killing everything else off. The oak presence is complimented perfectly by the burgundy wine flavor which is dry but still packs a lot of sweet, vinous fruit. Hints of dark grape, sour cherry, currant and juicy blackberry along with other dark fruit notes lingering over the sweet malt backbone and subtle floral hops into a slightly dry finish. The barrel is countered by sweet caramel malt, dark chocolate and toffee as well as a touch of earthy hop bitterness in the finish. The high ABV is expertly masked, making this delicious, complex beer dangerously drinkable. Although there is plenty of alcohol sweetness, there isnt any harsh heat, just some warmth in the finish. This is a truly remarkable beer that exceeded all of my expectations, and thats saying a lot because I really enjoyed Busch Prestige. This beer is really expensive but its worth every cent. One of the best wine barrel aged beers Ive ever had and I would definitely purchase it again. Highly recommended!

small sample from bottle at the bottleshop. dont know what to expect here. the normal bush is bad in every way. poured a amber colour with a few white bubbles on top. nose has still a strong malt presence. candy sugar, burned caramel, vineous notes, red fruits. spiced alcohol. grpes, wet wood, again a bad version. i have no idea why this is so high rated. its not that good imo
Bottle @ Craigs. Pours amber and with a haze. Sherbet, caramel, toffee salted caramel on the nose, slight carb in the mouth. Sherry desert wine taste and more of the same from the nose, really good.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear amber with a thin white head. Aromas of green plum, light spice very fruity. Taste is light sweet, almonds. Light fruity sherry finish.
Bottle at craigs. Pours deep amber, nose is funky, sherry, berries, taste is caramel, dry toffee, sweet fruits.
Bottle at the breweryRich, vinous, oaky, dark brown, vanilla, fruity, full bodied, well integrated fruitiness, half wine half beer, dark fruits, caramel, grapey

Bottle. Pours dark amber with beige head. The head stays for some time. Aroma is vinous, sweet, caramel, spices, and touch of alcohol. Flavor is sweet and sour, oak, vinous, spices, dark fruits, malt. Finish is sour with faint touch of alcohol. Overall: great brew.

Clear reddish-brown beer, medium off-white head. Nose is red wine, malt and fruit, mild acidity, berries. Flavor is woody, with red wine, tart notes, some more mild acidity, fruit and berries, malt that borders on breadiness. Dry and vinous finish, some warming alcohol. Smooth and complex, although the body has thinned from the barrel ageing.

Not sure what Cuvée Spéciale 2014 means, but okay. Light misty copper body, large head. Perfect looks for the style, faultless. Much more sourness than expected. Sticky fruit, figs, woody, berries, red wine. Quite complex. Really a beer that lasts you all night long and never bores. One if the best classic Belgians Ive tasted in a long time! (75cl bottle from trade with VDuquerroux, many thanks!)

Fles cuvée 2014 gekocht bij Drankenhuys Bergmans in mijn woonplaats Waalwijk. Ingeschonken in originele Bush craquelé graal bokaal. Donker, licht troebel amberkleurig bier met compacte crèmekleurige schuimkraag die zich snel terugtrekt, maar wel constant aanwezig blijft op het bier. De aroma's zijn complex en rijk met tonen van: rode wijn, rood fruit als rode druiven, kersen, aardbeien en frambozen, eikenhout en bierkelder. Het smaakpallet is ook zeer complex en extreem goed gebalanceerd. Met eerst smaaktonen van; rode wijn, rood fruit; druiven, kersen, aardbeien, frambozen. Daarna houtachtige tannines van eikenhout, port, sherry, aardachtige tonen, leer en bierkelder. De smaakbalans tussen zoet, zuur, bitter en droog is ongelofelijk goed. De Bush de Nuits heeft een levendige carbonatie en de alcohol van 13% is totaal verborgen. Het is een geniet bier, maar drinkt toch gevaarlijk gemakkelijk. De afdronk is droog, houtig en licht zurig, de hop lijkt getransformeerd in een zurig tannine achtig bitter. Deze Bush de Nuits is een ongelofelijk goed Belgisch bier, een van de beste, echter de Bush Prestige doet er niks voor onder. Brasserie Dubuisson maakt bijzondere bieren. Binnenkort de Bush de Charmes beoordelen!

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Vintage 2010. Hazy reddish amber with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, red wine and wood. Flavor is quite sweet, moderate bitter and moderate acidic. Dry, moderate bitter and moderate acidic finish. 250615

Bottle @ Christers. Pours amber with a offwhite head, loads of bubbles. Aroma of malt, yeast, light tartness, redwine, grapes, oak, light alochol. Flavor is malty, caramel, yeasty, redwine, grapes,, wood, alcohol. Medium body, lively carbonation, dry finish with warming alcohol. 250615

Bottle, 13% 2010 vintage. Slightly hazy dark amber with tiny head. Aroma is malt, caramel, toasted, yeast, little candy, oak, wood and wine. Flavour is malt, caramel, toasted, red wine, sweet, slight over carbonated, oak, little wood, little dry, notes of brett and medium bitter.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are rich fruits, red wine, wood, malt, caramel and hops. Nice and fruity. Very well balanced.

75cl bottle. Hazy brownish amber colour with a nice off-white head. Caramel, oak, vinous, prunes and malts in the aroma. Soft carbonation and full to medium body. Taste is complex with different levels of flavours but balanced and elegant at the same time. Long sweet finish. Overall, a very very good beer.
Wonderful plum and raisin notes. Some light sugar and vanilla. Thick and murky like muddy water. Sediment is amazing with flavor. Bottle

Bottle from Delhaize. Vintage 2013. Amber colour, small head. Fruity nose with notes of caramel, dried fruit, plums, berries and wine. Very complex. Sweet with tart notes. Light bitterness. Very good beer!

750cc bottle. Cuvee 2014. Pour amber with champagne like white-of head
Great brew. Very complex and distinct. Nose is grapes, wine, vinegar and apple cider. In the mouth it is more of the same but with wood aromas and a vermut finish. Sweet and extremely drinkable.

75cl bottle shared with a friend. Hazy amber brown with a small slightly off-white head. Full body with low carbonation. Medium sourness with sweet and bitter tones. Grapes, dark fruits, apples, vinegar, caramel, brown sugar and alcohol. Great complex brew!

Bottle 75cL. Home alone & the previous day with my dad. A sparkling clear brown beer with a big off-white creamy head ; good retention & lacing. Aroma of grape, prune, dark fruits, alcohol, roast, wood, biscuit. Medium to heavy sweet, warming note, light acid note ; elegant and balanced. Full body, medium silky texture, average to good carbonation, sweet warming finish. Overall, fabulous & delicate ; this beer doesnt stop time but surely slows it down...
Bottle. Amber with no head. Fruity and malty tones. Fruit, malt, acidity. Full body with a nice, bitter sweet after taste.

Vintage 2011 Cuvee Speciale. Absolutly Perfect Vintage Beer. Whats a smell, wine and wood. Oak Barrel from Burgund wine taste like perfect old dry wine. I love that stuff. Cudownie pachnace winem, kwaskiem oracz octem, niemal lambick czy Sour Ale. Piana bezowa spora sie tworzy przy takiej mocy zadziwia to, ale szybko opada, szkoda i wtedy przypomina szlachetne wino. Rubinowo miedziana barwa, metna i oleista. Niebywale geste, tresciwe, troche kandyzowanego cukru na ustach, silnie drapiace i szczypiace w podniebienie aromaty i moc tego piwa. La Bush de Nuits existe depuis 2008. Elle est faite à partir de la Bush de Noël mûri dans des foudres de bois ayant contenu précédemment du Bourgogne de Nuits St Georges. 
Par la suite, elle est mise en bouteille de 75 cl et placée, comme la Bush Prestige, en chambre chaude pour une troisième refermentation.
Le résultat final donne une bière de caractère, qui par son passage dans les fûts de vins dégage de fins arômes de raisins et vous offre une bouche qui ravira les palets amateurs de bons vins.
Derrière cette finesse, la Bush de Nuits Cuvée 2013 reste une strong ale qui cote à 13% au fort caractère et donc une excellente bière de dégustation pour les amoureux de la boisson mousseuse.

Bière de triple fermentation réalisée au départ de la Bush de Noël.
Nous sommes ici dans les sommets de la technique au niveau du brassage et du mûrissement.
Des foudres de Nuits St Georges pendant 6 mois minimun (on sen apercevra très vite
à la dégustation...) puis un séjour en chambre chaude. Une magnifique bouteille de type Champagne (en 75 cl bien sûr), du lettrage en sérigraphie, bouchon de liège, ferrure dorée, 
et une teneur alcoolique de 13 % abv.... On est dans les hautes sphères...
Couleur brun roux tendre assez spécifique à la Noël.
Clarté un peu de trouble par la levure incluse lors du débouchage.
Bulles moyennes partout et encore vives (mon exemplaire est du millésime 2009).
Mousse beige qui tombe assez vite (normal vu le niveau abv).
Arômes très vineux (déjà au nez de la bouteille), du fût, de la muscade, des fruits rouges et noirs.
Volume soyeux à doux de la 1ère bouche où le vignoble rejoint la brasserie dans un mariage
parfait. Du bois dabord, des fruits, du raisin à la pourriture noble, du malt (dans le vrai sens du
terme). Arrière-bouche sur les cerises noires et le cassis.
2ème bouche où on a le vin en direct, du tonneau de Nuits...Arrière-bouche à la belle myrtille.
3ème bouche assez indéfinissable   on dira en résumé que cest du style malt à whisky qui
rencontre des foudres de chêne au milieu de Nuits et qui parle dhistoires de bières ales belges
fortes. On est donc en pleine histoire européenne  (Ecosse, Bourgogne, Wallonie  ou si
vous préférez UK/France/Belgique).
La longueur nous fait découvrir les raisins secs, des fruits confits (abricots, poires), du single
de Talisker, des épices thaïes, du santal, du moût de Bourgogne, du marc de Jurançon.
La levure est un pur produit Dubuisson, très noble.
Lalcool est bien progressif, sans excès, mais ferme et vigoureux, pour soutenir toutes ces
saveurs merveilleuses.
La finale est un développement sans fin, ou comme disent les musiciens classiques,  des
variations nombreuses sur le même thème.
Conclusion : du grand art, de lart du brassage dabord puis de lart dans le mûrissement.
Quelle leçon de bière nous donnent ainsi ces brasseurs anciens des Belgian Family.
Une pure prouesse technique et gustative. Merci Dubuisson. 
(Pour lanecdote, sur 256 cotes, incroyable mais vrai, cette bière navait pas encore de 5 !!!
Je suis donc particulièrement fier de lui décerner ce trophée absolument indiscutable...
Merci les raters de mavoir permis cela  pour ma 256 ème cote  Oh ! hasard des chiffres)

Wonderful complexity here. Rich. Great sipper. Nice warming presence, but no alcohol feeling.  I love this.

Lots of wine notes present due to the wine barrel aging. Not being a wine drinker, this is a little off-putting at first, but it gets better the more you savor the complexities fo this brew.Pours reddish/amber with thin off white head. Lots of active, fine carbonation. Sour, oak, apple cider are tastes that come to mind. This is a great beer, but takes some understanding of the styles and processes to appreciate.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: dark amber beer with a white unstable head.
Nose: wine, very sweet.
Taste: alcohol warming feeling, very nice and complex, some chocolate, wood, wine.

750mL celebrating my best friends first house buy and my 5400th rating. Pours hazy deep red, fizzing out larger beige foam. Almost oud  brune wine barrel in the nose with sharp acid cutting head retention. Decent bourbon or rich oak nose but sharper red wine barrel funk. Taste is still on the sweeter side, but there is mild oak spice and red wine blackberry flavor. The sweet tomato and near bourbon character is never overpowering. Palate is effervescent, mild warming alcohol, cinnamon spice. Mild lactic balance. Really good. The real deal.

I think my 2011 Commemorative bottle is this one, as this was certainly different from the others. The best Scaldis Ive had as it hid the alcohol the best. A great caramel malt flavor. Really quite nice.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2014 2012 bottle given to me at Christmas by the wife. Having it for Valentines day, 2013. Pours a nice amber color with big hea that recedes quickly like a sour. Aromatic and fizzy bubbles. Aroma of strong sout cherry (unexpected), some plum or pear, hints of grape. Smells great. Look, feel and smell of a sour. Brett is present in aroma and flavor. Flavor is smooth cherries almost exclusively, sour kick on the finish with some lingering alcohol. A slightly dry oak finish. Really not what I was expecting. Medium mouthfeel that drinks very easily. Nice beer and not sure how to describe the style. Somewhere between a sweet dubbel and a kriek.

This is about as refined as beer gets. I could list about ten fruit flavours that I found in the nose. A hint of wild yeast. Full, round and deceptively drinkable. Has that big Belgian spirit, slightly tamed, but with the added nuiance of the barrel, yeast and obviously top class wine. A real treat. Thanks Tim.

Deep amber red color. Sour, vinous nose with lots of Brett, apricot, raspberries and cotton candy.  Sour start then oak and oak, wood, apricot, red wine comes in, tons of yeast, dry, full body, but alcohol so well hidden.  Perfectly balanced. Tartness just shines throughout. Beautifully sour, oaky with apricot and raspberries finish with Brett. Completely different than anything Ive tried and so amazing.

75 cl bottle, thanks to sebletitje. Somewhat hazy copper/amber beer with an offwhite head. Sourish vinous aroma, fruity, quite evident oak, leather aroma, dry woody, some red wine, berries, apples, grapes, figs,some almond, biscuits, notes of vinegar, sweetish, cork, red berries, acidic, hazelnuts and some brown sugar. Oaky flavor, vinous, some alcohol, vinegar, berries, hay notes, almond, red wine, vanilla notes. Great beer, just a little too much alcohol showing to take it all the way to the top. Woody finish, leather, berries and alcohol.

(bottle, 75cl) Hazy, amber colour with a short and tanned foamy layer. Moderately sweet and slightly sour dark malty aroma with vinous, almost Tawney-like fruity and woody notes, accompanied by caramel, hints of cellar and shades of alcohol. Moderately sweet and delicately sour-tart flavour, full bodied with a smoothly carbonated mouthfeel. Mildly toasted malty taste with loads of vinous berry fruits on a woody background; sweet and delicately bitter finish with vinous, slightly acidic fruity flavours, vanilla and a well-integrated alcoholic strength. A very pleasant barrel-aged strong Ale. 26.XII.12

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2013 Great beer! Unic, I loved it!
Deep orange-brown beer, small  head. Very woody/acetic smell, extremely liquorous, raisins too. Sweet taste too, but perfectly balanced by the huge alcohol rate. Extremely warm beer, very smooth. 
Great!

Wow! Un galopin ma été offert au passage dans une soirée trop chaotique pour en faire une vraie critique....Très élégant avec de multiples nuances. Je me souviens que le corps était activé par une effervescence tranchante et son alcool était enfouie derrière le brillant vieillissement.

Bottle, shared at a New Years party. Pours clear deep amber with a large beige head and minimal lacing. Aroma is tart cherry, caramel toffee, wood, red wine. Flavor is about the same, medium sweet with a light tartness that I wasnt expecting but was very nice. Medium body with a warming finish due to the ABV. Very nice beer.

vintage 2009, 75 cl, rood/bruin met minimale witte kraag.
aroma: behoorlijk overheersende wijn geuren, zoetigheid, toffee, caramel en rood-fruit.
smaak: fruit, wijn, zurig, moutig, caramel, toffee.
afdronk: iets aan de wrange kant, deze tonen overheersen wat.
persoonlijk vond ik de scaldis noel beter.

Clear fox red colour, off-white head. Aroma of wine, red berries, malt, vanilla, honey, caramel, wood and dried fruits. Rather sweet flavour, honey, caramel, malts, wine, light astringent, light sour touch. Full body, dry but sweet finish, malts, caramel, vanilla and wine.
Nice one.
(From 75cL bottle @ home)

Bottle 750ml vintage 2011
Pours clear deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, wood, dried fruits and alcohol. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter with a long warm, fruity and vinous finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Medium brown, noticeable carbonation, decent pale head. Aroma is Belgian yeast, grape skins, caramel, dark fruits, hint of oak. Slightly slick mouthfeel, sweet on the palate with a boozy finish. Taste is raisins, wine barrel, orange peel, spices. A little boozy and vinous.

Bottle from BVS, Brussels. It pours cloudy dark orange-amber with suspended particles and a fizzy off-white head. The nose is caramel, vinous, jam, grape skin, raspberry yoghurt, gingerbread, wood, prune and date. The taste is caramel, wood, leather, vinous, tart red grape, cherry, plum skin, sherbet, orange peel, spice, hint of vanilla, earth and some alcohol warmth. Medium body and effervescent carbonation. An elegent brew... good depth of flavour, tartness and balance.

Bottle shared by Tmoney99.  Pours a murky amber color with a big pillowy beige head.  The aroma had caramel sweetness, dark fruits, vinous notes, wood, vanilla and alcohol.  The flavor is sweet caramel, fruity, oak, vinous, and alcohol.  The bottle we had was a touch hot with prickly carbonation.  Maybe this just needed to sit for a while.

Bouteille: Amber coloured, some floaties visible, stable and lacy off-white head, very complex nose: wood, bretttg, toasted malt with fruity-vinous traces;solid sweet-bitter flavour and full bdied; lingering dry bretty-woody finish, sweet fruits again detectable. What a fine stuff

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2013 75 cl. bottle sample @ 18th Christmasbeer festival in Essen. Comparable wine / barrel profile to Prestige & RR Consecration  same barrels used (Prestige & this, not Consecration & this), I believe. This one hasnt got the weird additional flavours, much clearer, more wine, great stuff. Dark amber / fox red with a white head on the sides. Nose is very vinous, lots of sweeter red wine, red wine grapes, sweetly fruity, oak. Taste is sour grapes, lots of old wine soaked wood, Bordeaux, red wine, sugar, malts, some herbs, oaky in the back, light tannins, candy, vanilla, ripe fruits. Cleared out body, some oak dryness. Lovely stuff  really elevates the base, great wine (lots) added.  ///// Tried again 75 cl. bottle consumed about half @ home. 2013 Vintage. Not too long after release prob. Very impressive beer, carries a very distinct & unique yoghurt sourness to it with very heavy intring spice like wine barrels, lots of old strong dark fruits. Should take proper notes next time 4.4 -> 4.7 for now.

Bottle from 2009, thanks Meisty! Pours unclear thick syrupy amber in color with tons of sediment, small floaties, in the the brew. The aroma is sweet bringing whiskey like notes from the oak, definitely wood coming through. The flavor is sweet as well, the wine shines through nicely with some malty sweetness. The flavor is so smooth for such a high ABV, bringing virtually no heat at all.

Bottle. Clear dark amber/light brown body with a sparse off-white head. Aroma and taste of stone fruit (cherries), wood, toast and port. Geuze like in some respects, but with a rich, warming body. Balanced body, with a slightly bitter finish. Low carbonation, medium bodied, warming.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2012 Sampled at OBER Kerstbierfestival 2012. A bit unclear amber colored brew, virtually no head. Smell and taste malts, lots of alcohol, some sourness, spicy as well. Pretty sharp and spicy. Fizzy carbonation, medium body. Not my thing.

Bottle at VANØ Bergens Christmas Gathering 2012. Pours a hazy nut brown body with a small white head. Aroma is oaky vinegar-like herbal tones, hints of caramel, dark malts and alcohol. Taste is well-rounded wooden dark malt tones, herbs, hints of hay and red wine. Medium to full body and carbonation. Nice enough, and very original. This is a beer that, due to the barrel aging, straddles in the middle of the road between a BSA and a sour. Interesting, but I had higher hopes somehow.

Pours dark orange with visible sediment and a long lasting white head. Chardonnay dominates the nose. There is a sour oakey taste that finishes oh so smoothly. Enjoyed at Monks cafe in Philly. $40 for a 750ml.

Grazie a Sabrina per la bottiglia. Birra da grandi occasioni, proprio per questo sembra risultarmi poco bevibile, con i suoi esteri, la sua dolcezza che ricorda i canditi, la quantità di alcool importante.riesce comunque a rimanere una birra di livello, elegante, nobile.

My Bottom Line:
Apple cider and farmhouse character seep from this Barrel-Aged Belgian Strong Ales aroma, leading to wooden intensity, bubblegum and alcohol warmth.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam tops the misty red.
-Fruitiness is also redolent of black cherries.
-The soft prickling of carbonation makes the beer feel even more intense flavor-wise.
-Wooden tannins are prominent throughout.
-I was expecting more elegance from the Nuits St-Georges barrel; this is very flavorful, but perhaps too brash to truly be world-class. Too expensive too for my wallet.

Bottle.
Bottle. Brown hazy pour with tan cloudy head. Aroma is full of red wine and oak tones. Flavor is more wide spread, some oak, wine, light Belgian sugars, some darker malt tones. Well done.

Bottle at Belgian Beer Weekend, Brussels. The colour is very hazy dark amber with a very small off-white head. Sour aroma of wood, leather, rowanberries and cloudberries. A bit sweet flavour of red currants, sweet berries, wood and leather. Has a slick mouthfeel, and a light bitterness. A fantastic and complex ale.

Bottle, shared at RBAG Summer Session 2012. As a side note, this is the second most expensive bottle of beer Ive ever purchased (the first being Tactical Nuclear Penguin), so my expectations were pretty high. Hazy red-brown, fine lightly golden head. Aroma is boozy, with strong sweet notes, some nutty notes, some vinous notes. Flavours come forward as the palate adjusts to the booze: muscavado sugar, chestnuts, marzipan, cream, marshmallows, dates, dusty wood, leathery tannic finish. Quite warm, bordering on hot. I enjoyed it, but kind of wish I had laid it down for four or five years. Normally Id buy another bottle and do just that, but for the same price  I could buy a case of any of a dozen different beers that are equal or superior

text: Bottle at Brussels Beer Festival. Nice red amber body with slight head. Nose is okay, caramel, toffee and dark fruits. Taste is also fruity, very strong, oaks in there, some chocolate. Sticky, oily texture. Very strong and quite messed me up.

RBAG Summer Session 2012. Pours a reddish brown colour with a small white head. Aroma of lovely rich, slightly sour fruits, oak and toffee. Flavour of rich, slightly sour fruits, caramel, malts, mild hops and a massive amount oak. Full bodied with a slightly sticky mouthfeel and a dry, oaky, warming finish. Very tasty and quite complex.
75 cl bottle in Grebbestad. Amber a bit hazy beer with a small offwhite head. Red berries, sourish, oaky aroma. To much alcohol taste, it takes away all other flavours in this beer.

enjoyed as a sample of a 75 cl bottle on the antwerp beer festival end of june.
not bad, pretty complex variety on bush. but wine is , and will never be, my thing. and this was just to much like wine. i can imagine this beer is golden for some people, but im not one of them

75 cl bottle, thanks to sebletitje. Somewhat hazy copper/amber beer with an offwhite head. Sourish vinous aroma, fruity, quite evident oak, leather aroma, dry woody, some red wine, berries, apples, grapes, figs,some almond, biscuits, notes of vinegar, sweetish, cork, red berries, acidic, hazelnuts and some brown sugar. Oaky flavor, vinous, some alcohol, vinegar, berries, hay notes, almond, red wine, vanilla notes. Great beer, just a little too much alcohol showing to take it all the way to the top. Woody finish, leather, berries and alcohol.

Bottle 75 cl. Pours Cloudy red amber with a nice creamy beigish head leaving nice lacing. Aroma is nutty sourish vinous astringent buttery malty slightly fruity. Flavor is acidy sour vinous in front, mellow balanced malty with other flavors and medium bitterness from middle to end. Finishes vinous bitterish fruity, very elegant and well balanced.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2016 23rd January 2010Cloudy dark brown beer. Light sourish nose. Dry semi crisp palate. Sweetish malt with floral notes. A light touch of bitter water chesnut. Light touch of oak and subtle red wine and red fruits - well integrated. A little to dry but a well joined up enjoyable beer. 8th December 2016Bottleshare at Leightons Gaff. Thanks to Leighton. For the third time this  evening, a retry of a beer from over 6 years ago, but this one not aged. Hazy gold - amber beer, tidy cream colour head. Palate is airy and semi dry, decent fine carbonation. Soft light malts, mild creamy sweetness. Good red wine soaked berries and tang. Little dried fruits. Mild floral vibe. Light semi dry finish. Nice. Seems like a much cleaner beer these days. 3.7

Celebrating my SWMBOs new job!
Bottle, 75cl - Semi hazy red amber beer with a large frothy beige head. Aroma is malty with notes of dried fruits, walnuts, hazelnuts, port wine, caramel, coffee and toffee. Flavor is fruity with notes of oranges, honey, caramel, candy, cola, chocolate and nutmeg. A complete explosion of aromas and flavors. Insanely enjoyable! Im going to have sex after this.

I had two entirely different sets of reactions.  When i had my first glass I thought of a slightly fizzy slightly sweet red wine spritzer and was not impressed.  An hour later the same beer was delightful.  Is it possible that a red wine barrel aged beer needs to breathe?  Who knows.  Here is my second set of impressions.  Appearance is perfect.  Indeed, the appearance of the bottle is so perfect that the appearance of the beer hardly matters, but that is perfect also, like a slightly hazy, reddish tripel, but with a very small tan head.  Nose is complex but simple to describe, malts and Burgundy wine.  Taste is complex and simple as well, Belgian tripel, without the floral, lavender, lilac notes of the basic Prestige, but with complexity from from the Burgundy again.  I thought it was great, obviously, but I docked it a point for being over 10% alcohol and another point for its price.  13% ABV makes a beer scary dangerous, and $39.96 for a single bottle of beer, purchased at the case price, is just too high.  And yet, Im glad I have the rest of the case waiting for me!

75 cl bottle.
Rated on 20110709.
Pours clear brown color with a quickly dissipating head. Aroma of plums, raisins, malts, oak and spices. Flavor of oak, plums, raisins, berries, spices and distant fruits.
5436

Bottle...
Murky hazy copper/mahagony red one with a fine creamy off white head. Aroma brings the first shock.  Woody tartness, some barnyard, berries, a lot of berries, tropical fruits, overriped bananas,  spicies of vanilla, clove, dried fruits, prune...uhhh and the flavour: Oily bodied one, soft carbonation brings the wonderful character with a lot of fruitiness: figs, woody tartness, berries, dried fruits with some alcohol, soft texture, grape and some must. What a complexity, i can not believe, thanks!

Un goût incroyable, un soupson de sucre pour arrondir le tout.
Une odeur de vin très légère juste ce quil faut.
Un vrai régal !!

Bottle from the 2008 vintage. Pours light copper colored with small chunks and a nice small, dense, creamy and lasting off white head. Aromas of wood, caramel, berries, alcohol (surprisingly little), cider vinegar, christmas spices and candi sugar. Warming alcohol in the flavor and with notes of sweet malty caramel, tart wood and a rather dry finish.. Excellent beer!

(Bottle) Pours brown orange with red hints. Fast decreasing sand coloured head. The aroma holds cherries, red berries, wood, wet sand, tart cider, coconut and light vanilla. Undertones of super dry caramel, alcohol and mould. Really vinous and light acidic on the nose. The flavour is light sweet, light bitter and light acidic. Vinous, woodsy, berry-like and malty. The mouthfeel is round, full and soft with alight tart touch. Medium to full carbonation. Vinous, tart marzipan,-ish alcohol-driven and woodsy finish. Medium to full bodied.

25.4 oz bottle, 2010.  Murky brown with white fuzz.  Nose is toffee, grain, musty oak and wild grapes.  Oily, sticky medium body with a muted sparkle.  Perfect for sharing with small samples but may be a challenge solo.  Taste is toffee, apricot, honey, sweet white wine, vanilla and grass.  Quite nice and certainly worth trying once even though expensive.

75 cL bottle from Beers of Europe into a Westmalle glass.  Dark brown, very fizzy and with a good bubbly head.  The aroma is very nice, and complex.  You can tell the wine influence with the lovely red fruits, there is acidity and sourness.  A rich, very sweet taste, a bit like sherry, fruity and dry.  A fine sipper.
Apple and plum nose. Cloudy copper, thin head. Very vinous, tannic. still a lot of apple core and plum. a little boozy. Not really exceptional, but enjoyable.
UPDATED: MAY 26, 2013 Hazy, dark brown colour. Caramel, spices, fruits and oak. Oily mouthfeel with soft carbonation.

Bottled 750ml (BZ, vintage 2011)
Deep ruby-brown color, small off-white head. Aroma is a bit sour, tart, cellary, oak, red wine/tannines, some fruits. Medium to full-bodied. Flavor has Belgian yeasty fruityness, toffee and then evident tannines, red grapes from Burgundy barrel. Alcohol - of course - but much less than in normal Bush-beers. Complex brew.

(Bottle, 0.75 l - vintage 2009, from Systembolaget, 20111224) The beer poured reddish brown and quite clear. Its head was quite small and white. Aroma had sweetness, vanilla, wood and Belgian style yeast. Palate was full bodied, warming and dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were malts, sweetness, wood, vineousness, Belgian style yeast and very low bitterness. Aftertaste was woody and mildly bitter. Too boozy but otherwise nice balance between wood and beer.

750 ml. bottle.  A reddish pour with a small off-white head, orange highlights.     Aroma of tart cherries, oak, vanilla, mild tartness, belgian yeast, candi sugar.     Flavor is lightly tart, lots of caramel, belgian yeast, sugar.  Definite oak, some cherry.  Nice vanilla notes.  Some burgandy and vinous notes.  Very slight alcohol heat thats hidden well by the complexity of this beer.   Big, full mouthfeel, nice carbonation.  Really great beer.

cherry vanilla oak and a nice sourness all greet my palate. dark brown pour with persistent tan head. one of the few beers i could actually feel the heat of the alcohol in if i take too large of a sip. This beer took my palate in so many different directions...gotta retry this one a few times to try to get a better handle on it.

750ml bottle, vintage 2010, dark amber-copper color, with a bubbly beige head, but falls quickly, mild winey, wet oak barrel, vinous, red berry acidic, light musty, wild funky yeastiness nose, with somme tannic red wine, toasted, caramelized malt, brown sugar sweetness accents, with some brandyish, faint Grand marnier liqueur notes, when the beer gets warmer, with a hint of plum, juice in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a warmth alcoholic phenolic, musty sour red berry, wild winey yeasty funk, wet Nuits St-Georges oak cask, vinous red wine tannic character, with some toasted, caramel, biscuity malt, candi sugar, zesty juicy blood orange acidic flavors, with a Grand Marnier liqueur, faint sangria undertone, leading towards a warming yeasty, fruity, malty,red wildberry acidity, , winey, woody red wine tannic oakiness, dry finish.

750 ml stylish "champagne" bottle, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. Amber to brown colour, large cream-coloured head. Nice vinous aroma, notes of oak and "fruits of the forest", hints of farmhouse. Vinous, oaky and well balanced flavour with moderate but sufficient hops. Extremely drinkable for its strength.

Bouteille. Bière trouble de couleur ruby orangée avec une fine mousse beige crémeuse affichant une bonne tenue ainsi quune colonne de fine bulles au centre du verre. Au nez, elle exprime des notes de cerises sûres, de fruits rouges, de raisins, de bois, de malt sucré et dalcool. En bouche, le bois est plus présent et est accompagné dun bouquet de petits fruits (griottes, framboises, mûres) ainsi que de raisins secs, de figues  ainsi que dune pointe dépices, le tout supporté par une bonne base de malt bien sucré et qui se termine par une belle pointe dalcool. Tout y est en subtilité et en équilibre.  Elle est légèrement crémeuse et agrémentée de fines bulles. Une grande bière.

Whoa, ass kickass! Poured with a large cream colored head that lasts a very long time and a little lace. Color is a cloudy amber brown. Aroma is yeast, burgundy dregs, oak, malt. Flavors similar and just a perfect pinacle of pleasure with the highlights of burgundy in oak, yeast, fruit, malt, and  yeast. Finish  is similar to nose, has good length, and is sneaky as hell with the alcohol. An absolute masterpiece!

Murky reddish brown colour with a mediumsized off-white head. Aroma is caramel malts, some fudge, mild fruityness, spices as well as some slight wooden notes. Flavour is caramel malts, toffee, spices, alchohol, some fruits as well as some burnt sugary notes.

Bouteille de 750 ml, avec bouchon de liège, obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Odeur fruité avec une pointe boisée. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée voilée avec une forte densité de bulle. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de fruits rouge et de chêne avec une pointe dalcool. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement vineuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût fruité. (Rating #3931)

Bouteille de 750ml partagée avec Patrick, Julien et Pier-Luc. Bière ambrée avec un mince filet de mousse blanche. Le nez est bien vineux, fruité, boisé avec se qui semble être des brett. La bouche est puissante, les tannins bien présents. Cette ale est forte, chaude et elle a une bonne effervescence. Un produit singulier. Un géant de bière. 8/10

Merci à Yan et Patrick. Bottle at Iceland super tasting. Brownish amber pour with an off white head. Tannic oaky aroma, port, light cherry/vinegar. Taste is quite tart, strong alcohol warmth and a lot of winey/oak flavors. Palate is well calibrated body and carbonation wise. Very nice beer, too bad it is so prohibitively expensive.

Un anneau de mousse flotte sur un liquide à la robe ambrée et passablement voilée.  Le nez possède une certaine douceur avec de belles notes fruitées légèrement surettes et de belles qualités vineuses.  Lalcool signale sa présence.  Les saveurs sont très chaudes, pleines de fruits rouges, bien touchées par le fût et rattrapées par des notes poivrées.  En bouche, le liquide a une rondeur proprement belge avec une effervescence modérée et une texture à la limite huileuse.  La finale se fait sur des notes vineuses indéniablement réchauffées par un alcool piquant.  Une bière très élégante.
Very complex flavours and aromas. The red fruits are right there at the onset. The alcohol burn is significant. Flavours of spices linger quite some time.

Aroma:small fruit berry...
Appearance:hazy dark amber,light head...
Flavor:dark fruit,wood,wine-vinegar,alcohol....

Bottle, 75cl corked, at Bier Central. It pours an unclear, reddish amber to brown body and a dense, light beige head. The aroma is intense and lovely. Vinous and slightly acetic. Slightly woody and a bit sweetish, with the alcohol sure present. Some peppery notes. Very warming on the palate, full-bodied and smooth, with a fine blend of flavors. Red wine, vinegar, dark fruits, sugar, hints of dried fruits and a yeasty hint. Super-long finish, where the warmth stays the longest time. A true beauty. Just lovely. 110429

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2012 
75 cl bottle. Vintage 2009, BBE 2012 according to cork, BBE 2014 according to bottle
Sweetish aroma has oak and some raisins. Flavour has lots of sherry-like oak, some alcohol and some raisins. Not too sweet, but the oak is too overwhelming.

750 ml bottle. 2009 version.
Pours a reddish brown colour with a small white head. Aroma of lovely rich, slightly sour fruits, oak and toffee. Flavour of rich, slightly sour fruits, caramel, malts, mild hops and a massive amount oak. Full bodied with a slightly sticky mouthfeel and a dry, oaky, warming finish. Very tasty and quite complex. This hit my sweet spot.

Bottle at Bier Central Antwerpen. Red golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is alcohol, yeast, oak. Flavour is sweet, alcohol, nuts, malt, red wine, yeast, oak, vinegar, dried fruits, spices. Full body. Very nice beer.

Pours red-soaked amber with a modest light brown head. Nose is very tart and has a wine-like quality without being too similar to wine; some rich, dark maltiness is present as well. Flavor is extremely complex and dominated by brown sugar, grapes, dull fruits, alcohol, sharp yeastiness, all balanced against an almost hot, spiced hop and coriander profile. Some sourness in the finish. The booziness is big but does not really detract. An odd and very expensive selection, but mostly a pleasant experience.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2011 Bottle (trade with BelgBeerGeek - thanks).  Red wine, orange, cinnamon, and barley malt aroma.   Murky orange-brown color with moderate head.  Sweet orange and cinnamon flavor initially followed by a red wine and strong alcohol flavor.   Mild carbonation.  Surprisingly smooth for a beer this strong.

750 ml bottle @ Bier Central in Antwerpen.Pours ruby red with some yeast in suspension and an off-white head.Aroma of dark and sour berries, some funk, grapes and oak.Flavor is sweet and sour with some woody notes and sour funk.Slightly warming with some caramel notes.Medium body, average carbonation.Very nice beer.

750ml bottle shared with the Oslo guys at Bier Central. Dark amber body topped by a filmy layer. Rich aroma with tart fruits, raisin and dusty hops. Delicious taste of dried fruits, apples and spiced malts on an oaky backbone. Very dry ending. Solid, but integrated, alcohol warmth. A pleasure to drink a beer like this (Antwerpen, 29.04.2011).

750ml bottle tasted at Daknoles Memorial Day "Throw Down".  Pours a dark amber color, with big off-white head.  Aroma is oak, dark fruits and spices.  Taste is complex, but well balanced.  Sweet, with dark fruits, grapes, malt and earthy goodness.  Finish is spicey, smooth and warm.  Very nice ale, better suited for a cold winter night, but excellent anytime.

Intensiv hefiger Antrunk mit übertriebener Alkoholigkeit. Dies überrascht, dennd as Bier ist ansonsten eher mau und zeigt, abgesehen vom Antrunk, keine weiteren intensiven Aromen. Minimal nussig, hier noch wenig hefig. Schlichter Abgang mit wenig Süße. /9/9/9/fl/9

Medium beige head. Deep amber body. Wooden vinegary intensely herbal aroma. Dry-sweet-acidic malty vinegary wooden taste with buttery intensely herbal notes. Light body. Mild, hot, faintly slick mouthfeel. Sharpish. Dry spicy herbal aftertaste with cardamom notes. Very nice! (0.75l bottle, shared with Rune at Bier Central, Antwerpen.)

750 ml bottle @ Bier Central in Antwerpen. Hazy reddish orange with a big, frothy and lasting head. Aroma of oak, dry fruit, malt, spices and some light acidity. Flavor is malty and fruity, moderate bitter and has some acidity like dry red wine and alcohol. Full body. Quite a powerful beer, still balanced and the warming alcohol is well integrated. Without taking the high price in consideration and focusing on the flavors this is very nice stuff.

Bottle. Poured a hazy brown with a large frothy light brown head that was fully lasting with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy complex spice, fruit, yeast and alcohol aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture with soft carbonation. Moderate yeasty sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Very well done.

yet another beer shared by phaleslu at DLD.   Peter shared enough beers on DLD to quench the thirst of a small band of drunk dudes in their mid-twenties.  Notes of grapes, figs, brown sugar with some sherry oxidation.  a bit bready.  hint of slightly sour cherries.   earthy oak character.     more oxidation that expected.  complex.  tasty.

750 ml bottle from pepsican- thanks again! 2009 vintage shared at Dark Lord Day 2011. Pours a hazy brown color with some muddiness toward the bottom and a small off-white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, caramel, oak, chocolate, red grapes, raisins, vanilla, and sweet, boozy fruitcake. Flavor is a nice balance of sweet malts, oak, sugar, vanilla, and caramel with sweet and boozy dark fruits- grapes, raisins, plums, and just a little bit of earth. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a rich, chewy mouthfeel. Very complex and enjoyable.

DLD 11, thanks Peter! Pours hazy reddish brown, almost burgundy with eggshell white head.  Aroma has big layered notes of chocolate, oak, vanilla, dark fruits with figs, raisins, run soaked prunes, some grape skin, wood and other earth notes in there as well.  Taste is delicious, with lots of sweet dark fruit, raisins and prunes in the forefront, nice oak and toffee/vanilla sweetness mixing to get a sweet but drying effect, touch of booze on the finish but in a pleasant way.

2010 Prestige de Nuits .... Amber pour hazy with a golden hue off white head ... aroma of oak, wine, dark fruits (raisins, figs) and sweet malts .... taste is of oak, wine and dark fruits, caramel malts and lightly sour with a warming alcohol that leads to a dry oaky finish .... very balanced flavors smooth and delicious

10/04/2011 75cl bottle @ home  - 2009 version (2011-143) 
Little cloudy dark amber to brown beer, light beige small head, unstable and somewhat adhesive. Aroma: very malty, some caramel, lots of alcohol, raisins, dried fruits, ripe fruits. MF: good carbon, medium to full body, Taste: surprisingly sour, vinous, raisins, prunes, flower-candy (violets), flowery, caramel. Aftertaste: vinous, caramel, citrus.

Bought from Beers of Europe. Muddy brown pour with an off-white head. Vinous nose packed full of raisins, wood, tobacco. Rich, warming flavours of chocolate, raisins, oak, pear. Warming, soothing alcohol burn. Sweet, vinous finish. Lovely!

2010 vintage from Wegmans for Valentines Day.  Poured deep, almost opaque, brown with a nice foamy head that dissipates into a thin, off-white lasting froth.  Initial aroma is vinous, the rich wine is obvious.  Other notes of sour fruit, sweet but woody.  Taste is sweet to start that quickly turns sour and tangy.  Palate is medium and a little fizzy - not nearly as thick as I had expected.  Finish is long, tart, and very enjoyable.  The alcohol warmth is noticeable throughout but never overwhelming.  Im lucky that this is so expensive otherwise I might be tempted to drink it regularly!

500th Belgian beer. 2009 bottle. Reddish brown with a small to medium head. Fruity wooden and alcohol smell. Light sour wooden fruity, grapes, Raisins, taste. A bit wines taste, not complete my thing, but can understand others like it.

2009 bottle courtesy of Tytoanderso.  Pours murky brown with a half finger off-white head.  The nose is spicy fruit, brown sugar and red wine.  The taste is caramel, tobacco, vanilla, wood, sherry and spice.  Medium creamy mouthfeel.  Very tasty.  Thanks Tyler!
750 ml bottle red brown colored beer with a white head aroma dry fruits caramel liqueur spices alcohol and some hops taste dry fruits caramel wood liqueur spices alcohol and some hops

so nice, this one!
one of the best in the world.
A good performance from dubuisson.
Great deep taste, aroma and an absolute long finish.

One point to say is that youll taste the strong alcohol in it!
Bottle thanks to TheCheeseMan!  Slightly sour aroma with a big sweet malty flavor full of nuts, yeast, and more.

Aroma of brown sugar, nougat, brandied fruit and sour cherries. Appearance was ruddy brown with tan head. Flavor matched the nose, but with lots of oak notes; the sourness imparted by the barrels was more apparent upon warming, and was also quite boozy. Palate was fizzy and bubbly. A pleasure to drink, just not everyday.
Bottle sample from MatSciGuy.  Hazy brown pour and a wonderful sour cherry aroma.  Light malt, tart, tangy, fruity and effervescent all the way through.  Very enjoyable!

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2011 Bottle. Corked bottle opens up with a nice big pop but no gushing. Poured into to a tulip glass a clear light brownish red orange color wih a slight tiny bubbled head. Nice aroma of light fruit, oak, and red wine. Has an almost slightly slightly sour note in the nose. Light mouhfeel. Starts with a light fruit flavor like apricot and apple which leads to a tanic like wine flavor. Some booze type notes as well. Drinks really nice. Thanks to matsciguy for sharing.

Bottle shared by matsciguy. Pour is cloudy copper with nice frothy head that settles to a collar around glass. Aroma is sour funky fruit. Taste is sweet and sour fruit with a tangy malty finish. Palate is medium feel with solid carbonation and a chaulky finish. Very good!

Bottled thx to jerohen. Dark brown color, medium head. Aroma of a spicy and sweet belgian strong ale, fruity esters, slight yeasty, chocolat, roasted malt. And then mixed with burgundy red wine, very fruity, grapes. Smooth oak and sourness added to the belgian strong ale. Nice combination, but to be honest not perfectly in balance. It almost tastes like wine and belgian strong ale mixed with each other. It still is tasty tho.

Bottled, 2009 vintage. Copper colored, medium head. Nose really resembles a red wine, fruit notes, alcohol. Complex flavor, fruity, sour, some wood, perhaps some vanilla. Lasting finish. A good beer, the Bourgogne barrel aging clearly left its marks. However, too expensive for what you get to drink this more often.

Not as good as Scaldis Noel but pretty good just the same. Pours a murky brown with a decent tan head. Lively carbonation. The aroma is very sweet and fruity along with some spice and bread. The flavor is fruity sweet up front, then malty, finishing very warm and soothing. Quite smooth.

Funky tart edge.  Hazy dark copper color with no head.  Excellent smooth but complex with nice funky tartness.

Notes: Kerstbier Festival 10

75cl bottle, 2008 vintage, good to end of 2011 according to the label.  Bought from Geers in Oostakker, so in best nick, though hazy.  Cheaper than most at a meer 14,95.  Set it aside for a Christmas Day special, sadly.  It smelt and tasted of oxidised wine up front, I guess because that is what was left in the cask.  This clashed with the partially fermented, naieve, sweet, said-not-to-be-spiced barley wine.  The effect was similar to spreading crumbled mature Stilton cheese over Corn Flakes and adding sour milk with Canada Dry.  It got better after the initial shock but neither I nor my partner of the notoriously forgiving palate could finish it.  I have nothing against experimentation but not at this price.

tasted this one before 
head: beige and creamy/bubbly 
colour: dark , buttery amber 
smell: port/sherry/wineous, malts, candy , bit of anis, vanilla , nuts, caramel ( tiny bit )
taste: very wineous old port start , malt bitterness, sweetness of vanilla and candy , alcoholic, reminds of gluhwein , absolutly gorgeous ! im def. a big fan of this beer !

Shared by Joe at Jackie Os weekend. Thanks Joe! Poured hazy amber with a white head that dissipated quickly to the edges. Aroma was quite wine-y with dried red fruits, acid and warmth. Flavor started with slightly sour red fruits and built into a strong wine-linke finish, highlighted by dry fruits and an alcohol burn.

Handsome 750ml courtesy of tjthresh - thanks, Tom! Dark caramel color with a nice froth from the bottle conditioning, it certainly looks potent and almost regal. The nose is delightful, and I just love the wine barrels with a BSA, giving both the aroma and the taste a nice but not overdone tartness. It comes across like a worthy substitute of the usual sweet malts for something a bit more pert.

Bottle shared by Sparky27...thanks Eric!!!  Really enjoyed this one.  Dark crimson/chestnut pour with a moderate khaki head.  Lots of cherry, yeast, spice, caramel, nuts,  and dark fruit in the nose and flavor.  Definitely taste the Belgian influence and notes from the barrel.  The alcohol is very well hidden in this...was quite surprised by the 13% listed on the bottle.  Delicious!!!

Kerstbierfestival 2009. Pours a cloudy, brownish color with  copper highlights and a thick beige head. Solid aroma of wood, yeast, caramel, fruits and moderate alcohol vapors. The flavor is mostly sweet, caramel and candy, theres also some yeast, the wood is there, but restrained and theres also a moderate alcohol warmth. The body is medium with a liquorous texture and soft carbonation. Its expensive, but at least, its a very good beer.

Sampled July 2010 at De Heeren van Liedekercke
For the last beer of the night, we decided to put ourselves in the capable hands of Joost.  We decided to start out tasting the beer blind and see what showed up in our glass.

The beer is nice and cold on this hot summer night.  It has a certain mustiness to it and even a touch of tartness that seems almost acetic somehow and there is definitely a caramelized grain note to it.  The beer has a frothy, tan tinged, light colored head.  The body is a dark, burnt amber color that shows a clear amber color when held up to the light.  Aromas of raisins, prunes, proper caramel note, suggestions of woody mushrooms, hints of tobacco, quite nutty smelling at times and there is even some heat from alcohol towards the finish after a bit.

The beer tastes sweet and fruity in a non-descript way up front and the finish is a bit astringent.  Touches of childrens aspirin, concord grape, raisins, dates and cherry (last seems accentuated by a light acetic note) are all noticeable in the flavor.  This finishes with some heat that warms my esophagus. The beer is actually somewhat light body for its strength.  It really does have a nice nuttiness to it and the alcohol becomes much more apparent as the beer warms up.  The fruity notes are quite nice and seem to be the signature of the wine-barrel character.

This was a perfect end to an afternoon / evening of enjoying fantastic food and great beer at De Heeren van Liedekercke.  This is best described as a big glass of wham that sent me overly satiated to stumble up stairs to sleep.

Bottle, tfs Vaiz. Murky reddish brown, meium off white head. Aroma is very sweet, like grenadine with faint malt. Flavour is quite sweet with a subtle sour note. Theres caramel, fruit, some yeast and spices. Medium palate.
Good brew, but not my thing.

Bottle at home. Smells like wine. More grapes in the flavor. Quite soft and sweet though. Alcohol is well hidden. Smooth and round, and somewhat fruity. Nice balance. Nothing really special going on though.

@ Beer Weekend in Brussels (2010). Wonderful beer. Dark brown with small head. Aroma of dried fruits, yeast and alcohol, "panetone" like. Very rich flavour of dried fruits and wood, with some sweetness but well balanced and not cloying. A very nice and special one!

In short: A very vinous, very oaky, very tannic and surprisingly easy to drink beer.  Wow.
How: Bottle 750ml.  Consumed around 8 months after the beer release.  Tasting session with Montreal crew.  Bottle sent to me by tytoanderso, thanks a lot Tyler
The look: Cloudy amber body topped by a medium beige head
In long: Interesting nose of oak, grapes and cherries.  Taste is very vinous, more than vinous, this is fresh grapes.  Some other fruits such as bananas (really!) in there too.  The oak is very strong in this one and it really dries out the beer.  Lots of tannins too.  Very dry finish.  Yet despite its strong oaky sourness and tannins character I thought the beer was rather easy to drink.  No alcohol presence whatsoever.  A great beer to go with a full meal.  The problem is the very high price tag on this baby.  But the way I see it, Im just giving away pieces of paper that, at some point, were probably in a strippers butt.

Bottle at De Heeren van Liedekercke. Pours a cloudy dark amber with no head at all. Lots of sweet woody notes, some brandy-like sweetness. The flavor is warm and malty, nutty, fruit, huge dry barrel. Nice.

Bottle: Poured a murky red/beige color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma consists of lightly sweet malt with oak notes, subtle tart notes and a vinous character. Taste is also a mix between a lightly sweet non-descript malt base with tart notes and a vinous feel from the wine barrel. Body was quite full with good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. I must say I was disappointed by this one  I am not sure the wine barrel brought anything more that I appreciated. I was expecting more sour notes as opposed to some grapes. The price tag is another factor probably not helping.

09 vintage. Dark brown pour with a good-sized, frothy white head. Aroma holds definite notes of wine at the start, then shifts to massive components of raisin, prune, date, sweetbread, candied sugars, caramel, and molasses-- classic Belgian strong, but with increased wine presence. Flavor is lighter and carries more of the wine barrel aging-- plum, nectarine, oak, bready Belgian yeast, and a beautiful presence of Cointreau and red raspberry at the finish. Palate is smooth and luscious, but you can definitely feel the bite from the 13% ABV, though its welcomed. Very very nice brew.

Lightly hazy dark amber color with a small, off white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of caramel, vanilla, red wine, toast, toffee, and alcohol.  Taste of vanilla, toasted malts, some caramel, dark fruits, and alcohol in the finish.

Bottle. Fruity aroma and poured with a medium head. As you would expect it has a strong presence of alcohol with a slightly sour taste.
Some bitterness and the alcohol kick lingers for some time.Classy 75 cl bottle. Different but I wouldnt try it again.

Part6 of my wedding present, cheers Mes. Think this is the last of the fucking epic package you did for me. Would it be selfish to divorce and re-marry for another gift pack? Possibly. And shed feed me my knackers. Think this might have been one of the beers that brought on the gout attack from hell. It was worth it though! Very complex fruit and malts, nice bushy alcohol thing. I loved it. I wonder how many of my rates youre personally responsible for? Ill bet my top 100 has over 80% of beers from you in it. Should do that one day but Im always trying to catch up with a a crippling backlog. Speaking of which...

Bottle at a tasting thanks to glouglouburp
Appearance : Dark amber, medium creamy head.

Aroma : Vinous and woody. Notes of cherries. Quite fruity.

Taste : Vinous, oaky. Oak sourness. Tannic and a bit mineral. Very woody. No traces of alcohol.

Overall : Very enjoyable and interesting. At first nobody was sure if they liked it or not but after each sip it became better and better. Nose is awesome. Taste is a bit less. Very unique brew. Thanks Dany.

Courtesy of SHIG. Pours hazy opaque copper  brown with thin off white head. The aroma is tart berry fruitiness and tart Brett-ness. The taste is a bit punchy with carbonation pushing up tart berry fruity notes and then picking up increasing Brett like crushed aspirin qualities. Meh!

Bottle - 750mL corked and caged. Called Scaldis Prestige de Nuits and has Cuvee Speciale 2009 on the towards the neck. Pours a dark, murky brown with a moderate tan head. Aroma is wine, grape skins, tart fruit, oak, damp wood, and sweet malt. Taste is sweet malt, light wine notes, tart fruit, wet wood, damp earth, cocoa, dusty yeast notes and dark fruit. Body is medium with a moderate, creamy carbonation and a very light acidic note. Only slight warmth from the 13% ABV. Ends with more cocoa, sweet malt, wine notes, oak, damp wood, yeast and dark fruit. Very tasty!

Finished a bomber of this fine unique beverage, in the very glass it was designed for.  Thanks for sendng both BelgBeerGeek. Pours a blackish cognac coloured body with an initially notion only of a head.  The aroma is rich wine (it was aged in such for 6 months), and the taste is secondary to this Belgian ale, with some chocolate.  Special though not extraordinary special.Above average mouthfeel.

Big thanks again to SHIG for bringing the pain to the Tampa Crew this week.  This was one of the most intriguing beers.  Pours very hazy brown-yellow with a creamy off-white head.  Nose is malt, vinegar, tart, sweet, lemon, citrus, and sugar.  Flavor is similarly interesting: malty yet tart yet fruity yet tart yet sweet.  A better mix of sweet and sour I cannot remember.  Medium-bodied and very unique.

2008 bottle. Pours a dark copper to brown hazy color with a thin light beige head.  Aroma of old dark fruits, oak, wine, liquorice and spice.  Flavors are strong and complex, of dark berries and ripe bananas, oak and wine, liquore.  Good carbonation, bitter, sour and tart, dry with a long lasting liquor finish.  Very enjoyable, tonns of rich flavors, changes as you drink. A top brew.

Bottled @ UDRM. The aroma has sweetish berries and cherries, some wine and malts. Bit hazy, orange-brown coloured beer with an off-white, lasting head. The taste is sweet, caramel malty with a lot of fruits, some raisin. More alcoholic towards the end. Enjoyable.

750 ml bottle; shared by Mr. MJ himself during SBW 09; reddish brown with fizzy off-white head; yummy aromas of red wine, yeasty spices and tart apples; fluffy, delicate mouthfeel and quite vinous; sort of reminds me of T20 with a delicate level of sourness and lovely texture

Flaske: Ravfarvet let uklar øl med et lille skumhoved. Duften er tydelig rødvinspræget med en let syrlig note. Man er dog ikke i tvivl om at det er en øl. Fantastisk kompleks smag af rødvin humle, alkohol og en smule tørret frugt. Fantastisk øl med lag på lag, som et løg ikke en lagkage.
Had this one @ Unofficial Dutch Ratebeer Meeting. Copper colored brew. Sweetness, fruits in both aroma and flavor.

Bottle shared by fonefan on 8/28/09: Pours a transparent dark copper amber with a well-lacing off-white head.  Aroma of sweet toasty caramel with light fruity esters and nice vinous oaky complexity.  Starts with good malty sweetness and caramel toffee with lots of light fruity notes and good vinous oaky balance before a warming finish.  This should age very well, but is quite enjoyable now.
